data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: Bank regulation is a form of government regulation that subjects banks to certain requirements, restrictions, and guidelines designed to create market transparency between banking institutions and the individuals and corporations with whom they conduct business, among other things. Regulation helps make sure that banks have good management so they don't make bad investments or are too risky. Several ways are accounting for the regulation of the banking industry. Firstly, the government should try to prevent bank failures and losses to depositors by strictly regulating the financial system and by close supervision and detailed bank examinations. Banks are required to maintain deposit insurance, minimum capital requirements, and to restrict their holdings to less risky assets, such as government bonds. Moreover, banks must adhere to standard accounting procedures and disclose certain information that may affect their viability. In conclusion, banks are essential components of any modern economy; therefore, strict regulations should be adopted in the banking industry. （155 字）
data.referenceText: In what ways do you believe the banking industry should be regulated.
data.referenceTranslate: 你认为应该以何种方式监管银行业?
